title: Brighton Fringe’s Breach of the Venue Managers’ Agreement (2025)
claim: Brighton Fringe upheld the 2024/2025 Venue Managers’ Agreement in good faith, ensuring fair communication, promotion, ticketing, and settlement duties.
reality: Brighton Fringe repeatedly breached the obligations in the Venue Managers’ Agreement, using expired contracts, withholding minutes, delaying or denying communication, collapsing box office duties, erasing co-branded publicity, and weaponising silence against safeguarding disclosures.

laws.why: Expired 2024 contract enforced in 2025 without consent
Trustee duty to act in good faith, disclose conflicts, and protect beneficiaries

laws.act: Consumer Protection from Unfair Trading Regulations 2008
laws.why: Withholding operational failures while blaming partner

sub_contradictions.title: Failure to Respond Within Contractual Timeframes
sub_contradictions.claim: Brighton Fringe responded to venue managers within two working days / 24 hours during the festival.
sub_contradictions.reality: Evidence shows weeks and months of silence on safeguarding disclosures and operational failures.

sub_contradictions.title: Withholding of Board Minutes and Decisions
sub_contradictions.claim: The Chair emailed each venue after every Board meeting with details of discussions and decisions.
sub_contradictions.reality: Duncan refused to share full minutes, only selective extracts, leaving venues uninformed.

sub_contradictions.title: Withdrawal of Promotional Materials and Publicity
sub_contradictions.claim: Brighton Fringe promoted venues online, in print, and via physical materials (bunting, signage, Family Guide).
sub_contradictions.reality: Co-branded posters and brochures were erased, and later weaponised in a libel email.

sub_contradictions.title: Box Office Allocation and Settlement Failures
sub_contradictions.claim: Brighton Fringe ensured fair ticket allocations, prevented multiple booking fees, and settled within 6 weeks.
sub_contradictions.reality: Ticketing collapsed, public phoned Ben directly, allocations were mishandled, and settlement schedules breached.

sub_contradictions.title: Exclusion from Meetings and Constructive Dialogue
sub_contradictions.claim: Brighton Fringe held regular meetings, maintained groups, and ensured constructive dialogue with venues.
sub_contradictions.reality: Evidence shows exclusion from groups, erasure of communication, and constructive dialogue replaced with deflection.

sub_contradictions.title: Accessibility and Sustainability Failures
sub_contradictions.claim: Venues were supported to ensure accessibility and sustainability in line with Fringe policy.
sub_contradictions.reality: Audience data collapse and insurance failures left venues unsafe and inaccessible, contradicting obligations.
